Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Colistro was constructively dismissed by the Bank
Evidence_Assessment: Adjudicator assessed disciplinary actions, workplace incidents, and resignation context
Decision_Outcome: No constructive dismissal found; resignation deemed voluntary
Burden_of_Proof: On Mr. Colistro to prove constructive dismissal
Credibility_Factor: Adjudicator evaluated credibility of claims including bias and factual errors
Legal_Rule: Constructive dismissal requires fundamental breach of employment contract by employer
Procedural_Issue: Claims of adjudicator bias and factual errors
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court found no sufficient evidence of bias or procedural unfairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Disciplinary actions, workplace incidents, resignation letter, adjudicator's findings
Legal_Framework: Federal employment law, administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged adjudicator's finding of no constructive dismissal
Court_Result: Adjudicator's decision affirmed, costs awarded to respondent
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law on constructive dismissal, administrative law on standard of review
Defendant_Response: Bank maintained that no constructive dismissal occurred
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged bias, factual errors in adjudicatorâ€™s decision
Applicable_Process: Administrative tribunal process followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Patent unreasonableness standard in administrative law
